meanings.sent1: The parallelisms of the train tracks ensured a smooth ride for the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The architect carefully designed the building with perfect parallelisms in the walls.
meanings.sent3: The parallelisms of the riverbanks made it easy for the kayakers to navigate.
meanings.sent4: The parallelisms of their goals led them to work together seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The parallelisms of the road markings guided the drivers safely.

meanings.definition: Similarity or comparison between two things.
meanings.sent1: The parallelisms between the two stories were striking.
meanings.sent2: She drew interesting parallelisms between the characters in the novel.
meanings.sent3: The parallelisms between cats and dogs in that movie were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The parallelisms between the two paintings revealed the artist's unique style.
meanings.sent5: The parallelisms between the two theories made it easier to understand the concept.
